ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's really hard, but if you want to learn Spanish you have to take it.
Spanish 120 is a well-organized course that finishes up basic grammar structures and necessary vocabulary. I would recommend it to other students.
Great way to fulfill a foreign language distribution. I recommend this professor for Spanish. He is very understanding and reasonable.

Oscar is great--very engaging and always makes sure to call on people fairly. The class is hard--graded strictly to a rubric, which is nice because it makes it easy to know how you're doing, but also scary in that there's no wiggle room if you bomb a couple tests.
Sure, why not? How else are you going to learn Spanish?

I think that it is a great course, It is very well-structured and planned out and the instructors and format of the class is amazing! It is not hard to get a grade on. I took the class with Oscar Gonzalez. He is an amazing teacher. He is very funny, helpful and uses a lot of interactive media which makes the class more fun. If you get a chance, do take it with him!
I would recommend this class to a fellow student. It has homework every night and more exams then in L1, but it is very managable.
Yes, I would definitely recommend L2 spanish to another student. I learned so much between L1 and L2 spanish.
Yes I would. It helps you better grasp the spanish language.
I would highly recommend taking Spanish 120
I would recommend a different instructor.
